desc: PRKAR1A encodes for a regulatory subunit of protein kinase A. Mutations are associated with Carney complex syndrome and adrenocortical tumors.
gene/name: protein kinase cAMP-dependent type I regulatory subunit alpha

desc: PRKAR1A encodes for protein kinase cAMP dependent regulatory type I alpha, a protein that regulates cAMP-dependent protein kinase (PKA) activity (PMID: 26042218 ). PRKAR1A belongs to a family of regulatory subunits that binds and inhibits the catalytic subunit of PKA (PMID:15331577). Upon cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) binding by PRKAR1A, the catalytic subunit is released to phosphorylate target proteins at serine/theronine sites. Germline mutations in PRKAR1A are responsible for Carney complex characterized by skin pigmented lesions, myxomas, collagenomas, and fibromas (PMID:10973256) and for primary pigmented nodular adrenocortical disease leading to Cushing's syndrome (PMID:17036196,12424709). Deletions and loss of function mutations have been identified in adrenocortical tumors (PMID:14500362). In case reports it was found as a translocation partner for RARA to cause acute promyelocytic leukemia (PMID:17712046) and for RET to cause papillary thyroid carcinoma (PMID:7678053).
gene/name: protein kinase cAMP-dependent type I regulatory subunit alpha
